page.title: 15My Dad broke Clevedon Pier 1
page.content: This is Nicola Gay (age 10) reporting. The date is October, 1970. I am here in Clevedon to interview Mr. Robin Gay, Assistant Engineer to Clevedon Urban District Council. Mr. Gay, can you tell me what happened this morning? _Mr.Gay _ The pier is over a 100 years old and, for insurance purposes,has to be inspected every two years to check that it is safe for public use. The pier is tested by placing a series of water_filled bags over the decking. _Nicola_ At which stage did the failure occur? _Mr.Gay_When we tested the final spans by the pier_head. We started work at 6.30a.m and had filled the water bags by 9.30a.m. I was now ready to measure any up or down movement in the pier (with an auto_set level). _Nicola_When did you notice something?
